 235          """ 
 236          Sends an email using data specified in constructor

 238          Arguments::

 240              to: list or tuple of receiver addresses; will also accept single

 247                       and html source will be set to None; 
 248                       If text or html source is: 
 249                       None: content part will be ignored,

 260              encoding: encoding of all strings passed to this method (including

 263          Examples:: 
 264

 677 -class Auth(object): 

 678      """ 
 679      Class for authentication, authorization, role based access control. 
 680   
 681      Includes: 
 682   
 683      - registration and profile 
 684      - login and logout 
 685      - username and password retrieval 
 686      - event logging 
 687      - role creation and assignment 
 688      - user defined group/role based permission 
 689   
 690      Authentication Example:: 
 691   
 692          from contrib.utils import * 
 693          mail=Mail() 
 694          mail.settings.server='smtp.gmail.com:587' 
 695          mail.settings.sender='you@somewhere.com' 
 696          mail.settings.login='username:password' 
 697          auth=Auth(globals(), db) 
 698          auth.settings.mailer=mail 
 699          # auth.settings....=... 
 700          auth.define_tables() 
 701          def authentication(): 
 702              return dict(form=auth()) 
 703   
 704      exposes: 
 705   
 706      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/login 
 707      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/logout 
 708      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/register 
 709      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/verify_email 
 710      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_username 
 711      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_password 
 712      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/reset_password 
 713      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/profile 
 714      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/change_password 
 715   
 716      On registration a group with role=new_user.id is created 
 717      and user is given membership of this group. 
 718   
 719      You can create a group with:: 
 720   
 721          group_id=auth.add_group('Manager', 'can access the manage action') 
 722          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'access to manage') 
 723   
 724      Here \"access to manage\" is just a user defined string. 
 725      You can give access to a user:: 
 726   
 727          auth.add_membership(group_id, user_id) 
 728   
 729      If user id is omitted, the logged in user is assumed 
 730   
 731      Then you can decorate any action:: 
 732   
 733          @auth.requires_permission('access to manage') 
 734          def manage(): 
 735              return dict() 
 736   
 737      You can restrict a permission to a specific table:: 
 738   
 739          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable) 
 740          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable) 
 741   
 742      Or to a specific record:: 
 743   
 744          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable, 45) 
 745          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable, 45) 
 746   
 747      If authorization is not granted calls:: 
 748   
 749          auth.settings.on_failed_authorization 
 750   
 751      Other options:: 
 752   
 753          auth.settings.mailer=None 
 754          auth.settings.expiration=3600 # seconds 
 755   
 756          ... 
 757   
 758          ### these are messages that can be customized 
 759          ...

3717      Its contructor is also special. The first argument is the name of the plugin you are defining. 
3718      The named arguments are parameters needed by the plugin with default values. 
3719      If the parameteres were previous defined, the old values are used.
